cause.description:
CNI Foundation is a non-profit, non-partisan grassroots organization founded in 1989 by former Congressmen Paul Findley (R-Illinois) and Pete McCloskey (R-California) to promote a U.S. Middle East policy that is consistent with American values, protects our national interests, and contributes to a just solution of the Arab-Israeli conflict.
1. Total withdrawal of Israel from all occupied territory (the West Bank, Gaza Strip, and Golan Heights).
2. A shared Jerusalem, the capital of two states, Israel and Palestine.
3. A political atmosphere in which (1) a fair and objective media covers the Middle East without fear of retaliation by advertisers and pro-Israeli groups; (2) the American electorate is unafraid to debate the issues openly and frankly; and (3) our elected o
4. Normalized relations with Israel, her neighbors, and regional organizations such as the Arab League.
5. An elimination of all unaudited U.S. aid to Israel.
6. American recognition of a totally independent state of Palestine.
7. An end to all acts of aggression, provocation, and retaliation by Israel and the end of all violence and attempts to solve the problem by military means. This includes terrorism committed against Israelis as well as the state terrorism committed by Israel
cause.mission: Promote a just, peaceful solution of the Arab-Israeli conflict.
